meanings.definition: To form an arch or curve.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys arcking her back when stretching in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was arcking gracefully over the river.
meanings.sent3: The cat was arcking its body in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches arcked elegantly towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's body was arcking like a rainbow in the air.

meanings.definition: The act of bending or curving.
meanings.sent1: His arcking of the paper made it easier to fit into the envelope.
meanings.sent2: The arcking of the road ahead warned of a sharp turn.
meanings.sent3: The arcking of the river around the bend created a peaceful scene.
meanings.sent4: The arcking of the tree branches provided shade from the sun.
meanings.sent5: The arcking of the dancer's body mesmerized the audience.

meanings.sent1: The arcking of the rainbow painted the sky with colors.
meanings.sent2: The arcking of the building's roof added a unique touch to its design.
meanings.sent3: The arcking of the road resembled a winding snake through the forest.
meanings.sent4: The arcking of the hills in the distance created a picturesque view.
meanings.sent5: The arcking of the riverbank provided a natural barrier against erosion.
